text.p: Pastoral group Elders Australia Ltd, currently a takeover target by diversified manufacturer Futuris Corp Ltd, had postponed its annual meeting scheduled for November 1, a company spokesman said on Tuesday.
The spokesman said a new date for the meeting had yet to be determined, and the board had given no reason for the decision.
Perth-based Futuris, whose chief executive Alan Newman is chairman of Elders, on Monday extended for a fourth time its takeover bid for the pastoral group, saying it held an 83.2 percent stake.

Two offshore investors, Sir James Goldsmith's General Oriental Investments Ltd (GOIL) and the London based Marathon Asset Management, with a combined stake of about 15 percent in Elders, successfully blocked an earlier merger move with Futuris.
Futuris' offer is now due to close on November 25.
